results.title: Carry on sergeant
results.creator_credit: Gerald Thomas, Peter Rogers and Nat Cohen and Stuart Levy Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Carry on”.
On the eve of retirement Sergeant Grimshaw (William Hartnell) hopes, with the arrival of his new and last National Service recruits, to retire with the honour of winning the Star Squad prize. His plans are tested when the recruits show themselves to be a motley crew of prankish misfits. The first in the Carry On series is a bright wartime comical farce. With only a few of the regular Carry On crew we see Kenneth Williams (as James Bailey) in one of his funniest performances. Cast also includes: Shirley Eaton, Eric Barker, Dora Bryan, Bill Owen, Charles Hawtrey, Kenneth Connor, Terence Longdon, Norman Rossington, Gerald Campion, Hattie Jacques, Cyril Chamberlain, Arnold Diamond and Gordon Tanner.

results.title: Carry on screaming
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Carry on”.
A virgin goes missing in the woods in this ‘Carry on’ spoof, leaving her boyfriend and two hopeless detectives in search of her. Their only clue is the remaining gruesome finger of a “homo-garganturoso” (an extinct hairy man) at the scene of the crime. They happen upon a spooky house, complete with expressionless butler, buxom vamp and an undead master of the house. When the lost finger is subjected to an electrical charge, another large hairy man is generated. Why does the mannequin resemble the missing girl and what is the vitrification process? The horror theme is made complete with the usual toilet humour and innuendo of the ‘Carry on’ crew. Cast includes Harry H. Corbett, Kenneth Williams and Joan Sims.

results.title: Carry on Henry = Mind my chopper
results.creator_credit: Gerald Thomas, Peter Rogers and Adder Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 21 of Series “Carry on”.
The tale starts on the wedding night of King Henry VIII (Sidney James) after the failed attempts of his last wife to produce an heir. His new wife, Marie of Normandy (Joan Sims), with an obsession for garlic seems equally unpromising, and the King’s manhood at stake. Enter the buxom Bettina (Barbara Windsor) who Henry VIII just has to have, and a mix of the usual sidekicks; Lord Chancellor, Sir Thomas Cromwell (Kenneth Williams), his equerry Sir Roger de Loggerley (Charles Hawtrey) and Cardinal Wolsey (Terry Scott). When ‘the virginal’ queen is found to be pregnant the calamitous hunt is on to find and behead the head that dared before the king.

results.title: Carry on doctor (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Gerald Thomas, Peter Rogers and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Carry on”.
Britain’s favourite comedy team “carry on” as they only know how! “Carry on Doctor” looks at life in a country hospital when the patients revolt against the staff. Hattie Jacques is the fearsome Matron, Kenneth Williams the cold-hearted Doctor Tinkle, while Sid James as the malingerer Mr. Roper, takes a vacation in hospital. A madcap romp of bandages and stethoscopes, Frankie Howard as Mr. Bigger hams it up while Charles Hawtrey gives an unforgettable performance as an expectant father suffering all the symptoms of pregnancy.

results.title: Carry on Dick
results.creator_credit: Gerald Thomas, Peter Rogers and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Carry on”.
The 26th ‘Carry on’ film is one of mistaken identities and secret lives. Highwayman Dick Turpin - Big Dick (Sid James), is also the town rector, ably supported by Harry and Tom (Barbara Windsor and Peter Butterworth) - his parlour maid and the man who pumps the church’s organ. There is only one weak link in the chain - a noticeable birthmark on Turpin’s privates which will require the assistance of a bevy of busty women to bring to light. The charge will be led by Captain Fancy and Jock Strap. Cast also includes Kenneth Williams, Hattie Jacques, Bernard Bresslaw and Joan Sims.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gerald Thomas, Peter Rogers and Rank Organisation Film Productions

results.title: Carry on constable
results.creator_credit: Gerald Thomas, Peter Rogers and Peter Rogers Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Carry on”.
Fourth in the series of Carry On films, Carry on Constable plays host to the cast of ‘carry-oners’ whose camaraderie as actors made this series so successful. Sergeant Frank Wilkins (Sid James) receives three bumbling new recruits; Constable Charlie Constable (Kenneth Connor) who is plagued by superstitious fears, Constable Stanley Benson (Kenneth Williams) whose scientific deduction distracts him from the task at hand and Constable Tom Potter (Leslie Phillips) whose do-gooder intentions only ever create problems. Tested and exasperated the Sergeant follows the incompetent capers of the Constables into a farcical foray of chaos with much hilarity. Cast also includes: Eric Barker, Charles Hawtrey, Joan Sims, Hattie Jacques and Shirley Eaton.

results.title: Carry on camping = Let sleeping bags lie
results.creator_credit: Gerald Thomas, Peter Rogers, Rank Organisation Film Productions and Adder Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Carry on”.
The hilarity and double entendre’s fly fast and thick in this 19th film in the ‘Carry On’ series. Some well known gags abound, including the silhouetted tent scene that was reprised in the recent Austin Powers film, ‘The Spy Who Shagged Me’. Sid Boggle (Sidney James) and Bernie Lugg’s (Bernard Bresslaw) plans to trick their girlfriends (Joan Sims and Dilys Laye) into going on a camping trip for nudists (or so they believe), become unstuck. As a cast of characters converge on the campsite, like the ladies from Chayste Place, who are anything but - the fun erupts into a bawdy adventure. Cast also includes: Charles Hawtrey, Joan Sims, Kenneth Williams, Terry Scott, Barbara Windsor, Hattie Jacques, Julian Holloway, Peter Butterworth and Betty Marsden.

results.title: Carry on abroad: or, what a package: or, it's all in: or, Swiss hols in the snow
results.creator_credit: Gerald Thomas, Peter Rogers and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Carry on”.
The 23rd “Carry on” film finds a gang of prim and proper British tourists on a disastrous holiday. This is despite the reassuring name of the tour organisers and their location - Wundatours on a package tour of the Paradise island of Elsbels on the Costa Plonka. Their dreams of a luxury hotel quickly disintegrate when they discover the hotel is still being built, there’s faulty wiring, a leaky roof, all staff look suspiciously alike and there’s a disgruntled cook. Add to this the usual carry on shenanigans surrounding beds and showers and we are in for a holiday like no other. Cast includes Sidney James, Kenneth Williams, Charles Hawtrey, Joan Sims, Bernard Bresslaw, Barbara Windsor, Kenneth Connor and Hattie Jacques.
results.title_for_label: Carry on abroad: or, what a package: or, it’s all in: or, Swiss hols in the snow

results.title: Carry on
results.creator_credit: Gerald Thomas, Peter Rogers, Rank Organisation Film Productions and Adder Productions
results.brief_description: Between 1958 and 1978 British duo Peter Rogers and Gerald Thomas became a national institution as they regularly churned out a steady stream of saucy, slapstick, commercially successful “Carry on” films. They worked with a regular troupe of actors including Kenneth Williams, Charles Hawtrey, Joan Sims, Sidney James, Bernard Bresslaw and Barbara Windsor, although international comedy figures also made guest appearances. Rogers and Thomas were constant factors throughout the series, although production companies would change behind the scenes. “Carry on Colombus” - a commercial failure, was released in 1993, the year after Roger’s death.

They worked with a regular troupe of actors including Kenneth Williams, Charles Hawtrey, Joan Sims, Sidney James, Bernard Bresslaw and Barbara Windsor, although international comedy figures also made guest appearances. Rogers and Thomas were constant factors throughout the series, although production companies would change behind the scenes. “Carry on Colombus” - a commercial failure, was released in 1993, the year after Roger’s death.
